TvoyHit.title: Creating a player from the product catalog for the song store Tvoy Hit
TvoyHit.desc: Reworking the logic of the standard Tilda product catalog into a catalog of music compositions and integrating with a custom audio player.

button.desc: * full integration of the modification into your project using your design.

text.1: The client already came with a ready player design in Zero-block. There were only 2 tasks:
In order to start working on the functionality, it was necessary to complete the player skeleton. Namely, to add volume and music sliders.
text.2: For this purpose, the standard HTML components in Zero-block are perfect.

text.1: Due to Tilda's limitations in editing styles, it was necessary to override them.
text.2: This process is not difficult, but it also takes a significant amount of time.

text.1: It's time to bring this player to life and first of all, I start VS Code. Because this tool is much clearer to me than Tilda.
text.2: First, I defined all the elements I was going to work with. For the most part, everything comes down to a simple document.querySelector.
text.3: Now it was necessary to write down the functionality. For simplicity, I divided each possible action into separate functions.
text.4: After all the scenarios, it was necessary to understand how to merge all this with the catalog. By reviewing the requests that come when interacting with the catalog, I realized that all this can be successfully parsed. On the third attempt, I managed to write a script that calmly received a list of music tracks from the catalog.
text.5: Of course, I corrected the code 10-15 more times, refining the moments that I did not immediately notice. However, in the end, I delivered a fully working project.
